meanings.definition: One of the long, stiff hairs growing on the face of a cat, mouse, or other mammal.
meanings.sent1: The cat's whisker twitched as it sniffed the air.
meanings.sent2: She gently stroked the whisker of the mouse she found in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The whisker of the cat seemed to have a mind of its own, moving independently.
meanings.sent4: In the dim light, the whisker of the mouse looked like a delicate antenna.
meanings.sent5: The whisker of the lion was as sharp as a needle, ready to sense any movement.

meanings.definition: A very small amount or distance.
meanings.sent1: He missed the target by a whisker, almost hitting the bullseye.
meanings.sent2: There was not a whisker of doubt in her mind about the decision.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a whisker of salt to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent4: The car missed the tree by a whisker, avoiding a collision.
meanings.sent5: The thief escaped capture by a whisker, slipping away unnoticed.
